required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Laser Treatment for the Clinical Improvement of Acne Vulgaris: A Self-Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, we are enrolling subjects with moderate to severe acne vulgaris and investigating the use of a commercially available laser in treating acne.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Physician's Global Assessment (PGA) of Acne Severity
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in PGA score between baseline visit and post procedural visit
primary_outcome.description: The physician will score the acne vulgaris based on the Physician's Global Assessment (PGA) scale. A score of 0 indicates that residual hyperpigmentation and erythema may be present; a score of 1 indicates that there are a few scattered comedones and a few small papules; a score of 3 indicates that more than half of the face is involved, that there are many comedones, papules, and pustules, and that one nodule may be present; a score of 4 indicates that the entire face is involved, covered with comedones, numerous papules and pustules, and a few nodules and cysts. The change in PGA score will be recorded at each of the 4 study visits, for up to

arm_group.description: Subjects in this arm will undergo laser treatment on their active acne vulgaris lesions. Subjects will serve as their own control.

intervention.description: Subjects with undergo laser exposure of their active acne vulgaris.

facility.name: MGH Clinical Unit for Research Trials & Outcomes in Skin
